name: squalidly
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that is extremely dirty and unpleasant: The mother and son were left living squalidly in the big city.
in a way that is morally wrong and unpleasant: Why were the shareholders treated so squalidly? His leadership was squalidly oppressive.
More examplesFewer examplesThey lived squalidly in crowded tenement blocks. We hear about them going round getting squalidly drunk and swearing horribly.Two million soldiers died squalidly in the mud of northern France.
